channel.title: PinoyTechFeed
channel.description: Latest gadget updates and Philippine tech news — curated by PinoyTechFeed.

item.title: Marcos vows to continue cleansing gov't ranks despite being hard, painful
item.description: While admitting that it is not an easy task, President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Tuesday ensured that the government continues to cleanse its ranks.

item.title: 2 rider, kritikal nang magsalpukan sa Phil-Am Road sa GenSan
item.description: Nasa kritikal na kondisyon ang dalawang rider matapos silang magkasalpukan sa Phil-Am Road, Barangay Tambler, General Santos City.

item.title: Huawei Mate 70 Air listed online, design and key specs revealed
item.description:
Huawei may add a new phone to last year’s Mate 70 lineup soon. A phone called the Mate 70 Air has been listed on the China Telecom website, which reveals its design and key specifications.
The Huawei Mate 70 Air is expected to be a slim and lightweight phone set to compete with the recent influx of “Air” models from other brands.
It is listed on the China Telecom website with the model number SUP-AL90. The phone features a 6.9-inch display and runs HarmonyOS 5.
The images show a phone with a circular rear camera module with three sensors, including a periscope telephoto unit....

item.title: Marcoleta grills DOJ over Discayas' state witness bid
item.description: Senator Rodante Marcoleta on Tuesday once again questioned the Department of Justice (DOJ) for insisting that contractors Sarah and Curlee Discaya should return illegally acquired wealth, if any, to the state coffers before they can be entered into the Witness Protection Program (WPP).

item.title: Marcos: Metrobank awardees examples of goodness amid challenging times
item.description: President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. on Tuesday recognized the awardees of the 2025 Metrobank Foundation Outstanding Filipinos, saying that service wears many faces but is bound with the goal of serving communities and the country.

item.title: Bride, sumuong sa rumaragasang baha para ituloy ang kasal sa Iloilo
item.description: Bride, sumuong sa rumaragasang baha para ituloy ang kasal sa Iloilo

item.title: Calapan Bishop-Emeritus Warlito Cajandig passes away at 81
item.description: Retired Calapan Bishop Most Rev. Warlito Cajandig died on Tuesday at the age of 81, the Apostolic Vicariate of Calapan said.

item.title: PM Sanae Takaichi, a heavy metal drummer, is Japan's Iron Lady 2.0
item.description: TOKYO, Japan -- Sanae Takaichi, a staunch conservative who admires Margaret Thatcher, became Japan's first woman prime minister on Tuesday, but analysts say her rise does not necessarily signal a feminist victory.

item.title: PAGCOR, NPC ink accord to bolster data privacy protection in gaming sector
item.description: The Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corporation (PAGCOR) and the National Privacy Commission (NPC) have forged a partnership aimed at bolstering data privacy protection and ensuring regulatory compliance across the country"s gaming sector.

item.title: Hardliner Takaichi elected as Japanese premier, shattering glass ceiling
item.description: TOKYO - Hardline conservative Sanae Takaichi was elected Japan's first female prime minister on Tuesday, shattering the nation's glass ceiling and setting it up for a forceful turn to the right.

item.title: Missing sabungeros murder complaint submitted for reso -- DOJ
item.description: The murder complaint filed against businessman Charlie “Atong” Ang and other individuals over the missing sabungeros has been submitted for resolution, a prosecutor of the Department of Justice (DOJ) said Tuesday.

item.title: BI: 2 foreign fugitives arrested in Olongapo, Cagayan de Oro
item.description: Operatives of the Bureau of Immigration (BI) nabbed two foreign fugitives in separate arrests in Olongapo and Cagayan de Oro City.

item.title: Ex-DOH chief Garin urges gov't: Provide free face masks for Undas 2025 exodus
item.description: As thousands of travelers are expected to take public transportation and visit cemeteries for All Saints' Day and All Souls' Day, House Deputy Speaker and former health secretary Janette Garin on Tuesday called on the government to provide free face masks and vaccines to the public.

item.title: Bong Go on Trillanes complaint: 'Culprits should be held liable"
item.description: Senator Bong Go on Tuesday urged former senator Antonio Trillanes IV to not deviate from the truth as he insisted that the real perpetrators behind the anomalous flood control projects should be held accountable.

item.title: The latest iOS 26.1 beta lets you tone down the Liquid Glass
item.description:
iOS 26 launched last month with a huge redesign and the Liquid Glass UI, which has seen mixed reviews. While it is undoubtedly fresher-looking than iOS' previous UI, it's also definitely giving Windows Vista. Oh, and some people find that it has way too much transparency, which can impede usability.
Apple has toned down the transparency since the first iOS 26 beta came out, so it's less in the final release than the company was initially planning. But if it's still too much for you, the upcoming iOS 26.1 will help. In the latest beta of this release, which went out today, there's a toggle...

item.title: DPWH: Only 22 PH classrooms finished so far in 2025
item.description: Out of the 1,700 classrooms targeted to be built this year, only 22 classrooms have been finished so far by the Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH).

item.title: Comelec: 31K registrants in first day of 2026 BSKE, SRAP registration
item.description: The Commission on Elections (Comelec) on Tuesday reported that over 31,000 people participated in the resumption of the voter registration period for the 2026 Barangay and Sangguniang Kabataan elections (BSKE) in Metro Manila and Special Register Anywhere Program (SRAP).

item.title: Here's the global Oppo Find X9 and Find X9 Pro's battery capacity
item.description:
Oppo launched the Find X9 and Find X9 Pro in China last week, and the two will be going global on October 28. Ahead of that, you may have been anxious about the global models' battery capacities, since a lot of times the huge batteries that are available in China shrink on their way to other markets (especially Europe).
Well, fret not for this will not be the case for Oppo's new flagships. According to the devices' EU Energy Labels, they have the same battery capacities as in China. In fact, according to a tipster over on X, their full spec sheets will be unchanged.
Oppo Find X9...

item.title: Trillanes sues ex-Pres. Duterte, Bong Go for plunder, graft
item.description: Former senator Antonio Trillanes IV on Tuesday filed with the Office of the Ombudsman plunder and graft complaints against former President Rodrigo Duterte and Senator Christopher "Bong" Go.

item.title: DBM OKs release of P783.28M for performance bonus of Navy, PAF, NICA personnel
item.description: The Department of Budget and Management (DBM) on Tuesday announced it has approved the release of nearly P800 million for the 2023 Performance-Based Bonuses (PBB) of qualified members of the Philippine Navy (PN), Philippine Air Force (PAF), and National Intelligence Coordinating Agency (NICA).

item.title: Dizon OK with further DPWH budget cuts: 'Para masiguro na hindi mananakaw"
item.description: Public Works and Highways Secretary Vince Dizon on Tuesday said he is all right with the 2026 budget of the DPWH potentially getting trimmed down further in a bid to curb corruption in the agency.

item.title: vivo X300 Pro in for review
item.description:
We had the chance to handle the vivo X300 Pro at the launch of the X300 series in China, but the phone is now at the office and in for a proper review.
We can also put it side by side with its predecessor, which reveals a few differences. Most notably, the new phone is smaller in all dimensions.
The vivo X300 Pro, right, and the X200 Pro on the right
A key difference is in the displays. The X300 Pro has a flat-edged screen, whereas the X200 Pro has a slight curve to its display. The vivo faithfuls here at HQ are unsure whether they like their old, slightly curved screen or the...

item.title: Massive flooding in Western Visayas affects over 32,000 families
item.description: Massive flooding in Western Visayas on October 18, 2025 has affected over 32,000 families, or at least 116,000 individuals.

item.title: With one RFID all tollways project, Marcos vows easy travel for Pinoys
item.description: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Tuesday highlighted the government's commitment to ensuring a smooth travel for travelers as the administration launches the Toll Collection System Interoperability Project, which is dubbed as ''One RFID, All Tollways.''

item.title: Ask Atty. Gaby: Nang-ararong UV Express
item.description: Atty., negatibo raw ang driver sa pag-inom ng alcohol pero ang driver umamin sa Department of Transportation na may ininom siyang illegal substance bago ang trahedya. Ano ba ang sinasabi ng batas tungkol dito at ano ang habol ng mga biktima?

item.title: Palace on probing VP Sara"s use of confi funds: Up to Ombudsman
item.description: Malacañang on Tuesday said it is up to the Office of the Ombudsman to investigate Vice President Sara Duterte's use of confidential funds from her office from 2022 to 2023.

item.title: Redmi reveals the K90 Pro Max's key features, gigantic battery included
item.description:
Redmi is making the K90 Pro Max official on October 23, and ahead of that it showed us the phone's design a few days ago. Today, the brand has decided to also reveal its key specs.
Let's start with the battery, because it's massive: 7,560 mAh. It supports 100W wired, 50W wireless, and 22.5W reverse wired charging, and is even advertised to be fully compatible with 100W PPS chargers.
Redmi K90 Pro Max key specs teasers
At the helm sits Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5, paired with a new "AI independent display chip" D2. The SoC is cooled by Xiaomi's largest vapor...

item.title: Floating bag with illegal drugs recovered from West Philippine Sea
item.description: A bag found floating in the waters near Sabina Shoal in the West Philippine Sea on Saturday yielded suspected illegal drugs, the Philippine Navy said.

item.title: Here's when the Huawei Mate 80 series is rumored to launch
item.description:
Huawei's Mate 80 series could be announced as soon as November, according to a new rumor from Digital Chat Station on Weibo. That may still change and the launch could slip into December, but for now November seems to be the plan.
The Mate 80 will allegedly be available in black, white, and turquoise. Interestingly, the Mate 80 phones will be joined at their launch event by a "2-in-1 tablet", though it's not clear at all what that means.
Leaked Huawei Mate 80 image
Regardless, this mystery device will be offered in Moonlight Silver and Space Gray. A previous rumor told us to expect...

item.title: Xiaomi 17 Pro Max in for review
item.description:
The iPhone 17 Pro Max had just about 1 month of being able to call itself the best Pro Max around! The Xiaomi 17 Pro Max may be a corny namestealer, but it's about as serious on the specs front as you can get.
What immediately grabs the attention is the rear screen, so let's talk about it. It's absolutely top notch - a 120 Hz LTPO OLED panel with a peak brightness of 3,500 nits.
On the software side, the rear screen isn't very useful. It technically supports third-party apps, but only Chinese ones are allowed for now. Hardly surprising, since the phone is only available in China and...
